p: Hofmann clathrates and their analogues form one the most famous families of compounds that are able to incorporate guest mol­ecules. The first clathrate was obtained by Hofmann and Küspert in 1897 (Hofmann & Küspert, 1897 ▸) and was of composition [Ni(NH 3) 2Ni(CN) 4]·2C 6H 6. It was a 2D coord­in­ation compound formed by infinite cyano­metallic layers that propagate along the ab plane. The 2D system was supported by ammine axial ligands, and guest mol­ecules of benzene were trapped between the layers.
